artefact.overview: You need a licence to operate a day care setting in Northern Ireland
artefact.will_continue_on: the Health and Social Care Regulation and Quality Improvement Authority (RQIA) website
artefact.licence_short_description: Licence to operate a day care setting in Northern Ireland.
artefact.licence_overview:
If you operate a day care setting in Northern Ireland, you must comply with the [Day Care Setting Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007](http://www.legislation.gov.uk/nisr/2007/234/contents/made "Day Care Setting Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007"){:rel="external"} and be registered with the [Health and Social Care Regulation and Quality Improvement Authority (RQIA).](http://www.rqia.org.uk/home/index.cfm "Health and Social Care Regulation and Quality Improvement Authority (RQIA)"){:rel="external"}

If you wish to operate or manage more than one service, you must make a separate application for each organisation.

You must comply with any conditions attached to a registration.

If you fail to comply with requirements, you may commit an offence.
